com.nokia.maps.component.touch

Class VisibleTouchComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.component.AbstractMapComponent
      • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.TouchComponent
        • com.nokia.maps.component.touch.VisibleTouchComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractButtonComponent, ContextMenuComponent, InfoBubbleComponent

    public abstract class VisibleTouchComponent
extends TouchComponent
    This class is an abstract base class for MapComponents which are visible and respond to touch. The class forms a framework for highlighting the visible UI of the MapComponent

    The class does the following:

    • Whenever a pointerPressed() event occurs within the hit area of the VisibleTouchComponent, the MapComponent is highlighted.
    • Whenever a pointerDragged() event occurs outside of a highlighted VisibleTouchComponent , the highlighting is removed. This is the cancel event.
    • Whenever a pointerReleased() event occurs within a highlighted VisibleTouchComponent , the highlighting is removed, and the touchAt() method is called.

    Subclasses should override the touchAt() method to do any necessary processing, fire Commands etc.

      • touchAt

        protected void touchAt(Point point)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a UI Element has been touched and released. By default the UI element highlighting is removed.
        Specified by:
        touchAt in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        point - the position touched on screen

      • isActive

        protected boolean isActive(int x,
               int y)
        This method determines whether a UI element is active - i.e. if a touch has not been canceled.
        Specified by:
        isActive in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if the UI element is currently highlighted, false otherwise.

      • onTouchEventStart

        protected boolean onTouchEventStart(int x,
                        int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a pointer press has started. This action cause the the UI to be Highlighted when it is touched.
        Overrides:
        onTouchEventStart in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        false since the touch event is not consumed by default.

      • onDragEvent

        protected boolean onDragEvent(int x,
                  int y)
        This method is a code hook to allow for the consumption of an event when a drag event occurs. This stops the highlighting the UI.
        Overrides:
        onDragEvent in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        true if the component consumes the event, false otherwise. By default drag events are consumed if they occur within the hit area of the MapComponent

      • getTouchPoint

        protected Point getTouchPoint(int x,
                  int y)
        This method calculates the pixel location on the UI item the touch event occurred.
        Overrides:
        getTouchPoint in class TouchComponent
        Parameters:
        x - x axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        y - y axis pixel coordinate on the screen that has been touched.
        Returns:
        The pixel coordinate of the TouchComponent which has been touched, by default this is the same as the pixel coordinate of the screen which has been touched, but the axes may be overridden

      • paint

        public void paint(javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics g)
        This method renders the VisibleTouchComponent using the Graphics object.

        For a VisibleTouchComponent, the painting of the component is usually delegated to an instance of a Renderer to display texts, images and backgrounds etc. This method may be overridden to provide further complex rendering of the MapComponent.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface MapComponent
        Overrides:
        paint in class AbstractMapComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object used for rendering
